channel.title: What exactly does this mean?
channel.description:
[IMG]http://i1006.photobucket.com/albums/af190/justinxg27/lolwtfbb1.jpg[/img]
if you can't read it: [b]Excess usage does not apply to 'yes' Fusion $99, $109 and $129 plans, instead these plans have unlimited data allowance unthrottled up to 15GB, 30GB and 50GB respectively, includes uploads and downloads, after which the service will be speed limited to 256kbps until the end of your billing month. Usage means monthly combined upload and download data transfer. 1 Gigabyte (GB) = 1000 Megabytes (MB).[/b]
I don't really understand it. Because few weeks ago, my plan was the 109$ one, and I got charged 400$ for going over 2 gigs (If you could remember that topic I made.)...
So my parents changed it, but.. for 20$ more, 50gig, then just speed capped? as you can see in the picture above my current usage is 50.7gigs. Do you think I will be charged extra, like when I was on my 109$ plan?.. or should I be calm and believe there hard to understand policy?..

item.title: What exactly does this mean?
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

lolwtfbb1.jpg834×591

if you can’t read it:
Excess usage does not apply to ‘yes’ Fusion $99, $109 and $129 plans, instead these plans have unlimited data allowance unthrottled up to 15GB, 30GB and 50GB respectively, includes uploads and downloads, after which the service will be speed limited to 256kbps until the end of your billing month. Usage means monthly combined upload and download data transfer. 1 Gigabyte (GB) = 1000 Megabytes (MB).

I don’t really understand it. Because few weeks ago, my plan was the 109$ one, and I got charged 400$ for going over 2 gigs (If you could remember that topic I made.)…

So my parents changed it, but… for 20$ more, 50gig, then just speed capped? as you can see in the picture above my current usage is 50.7gigs. Do you think I will be charged extra, like when I was on my 109$ plan?.. or should I be calm and believe there hard to understand policy?..

Read full topic
